Health and Wellness
About UVM Health Network
The University of Vermont Health Network

Taking care of yourself – both physically and mentally – is essential in preventing illness and injury. The University of Vermont Health Network provides patients and community members a wide variety of prevention and wellness programs to help you stay healthy.

Stay informed on the latest issues that impact your health and wellness. Read stories with insights from experts around the UVM Health Network regarding a variety of topics, ranging from Children's Health and Cancer to Chronic Conditions and Mental Health.
Browse our stories
As we adjust to the normal of COVID-19, it’s important that you stay informed and continue to follow best practices for avoiding illness.
Learn how to stay healthy and cope with COVID-19
Use our health library to make better health decisions. Visit our learning center, use our interactive tools or search health-related topics for the latest in medical knowledge.
Explore our online tools and learning centers

The Frymoyer Community Health Resource Center offers free educational programs, classes and workshops on healthy lifestyles, safety and wellness. Our Fall Series is being held virtually in response to COVID-19.
Explore HealthSource classes

From diagnosed patients to survivors and family members, we offer support groups both locally and nationally for anyone in need of support. Search our extensive database or visit the links below to find the group that is right for you.
Explore support groups
Explore our archive of HealthSource newsletters, for tips and tricks on staying healthy and living well.
View newsletter archive
© 2023 The University of Vermont Health Network
